messages.message:
<!channel>

Hi all -- I am getting very close to removing Bazel from the Go build. I wanted to give everyone a heads up that we will remove it early next week.

To help folks out, here's a guide for common Bazel tasks and their native Go equivalents. I'll re-post this again next week too.

Build a package:
```bazel build //shared-utils/go-utils/src/instabase/utils/... => 

go build instabase/utils/...```
Run a test:
```bazel test //shared-utils/go-utils/src/instabase/utils/... => 

go test instabase/utils/...```
Generate protos: (see https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/72184 for commentary)
```(bazel generated these previously) => 

go generate instabase/protos/...```
Generate mocks: (see https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/72184 for commentary)
```(bazel or make command, depending on the package) => 

go generate instabase/mocks/...```
Other commands related to services (`make build-docker run-docker` etc) remain the same, but will be powered by `go build` instead of `bazel build`. Let me know if you have any questions!

Other changes: If you have `GOPACKAGESDRIVER` set to the Bazel packages driver in your editor, remove that setting. It's not needed with the native Go builds. Hooray for being able to build and use the Go language server at the same time!!
very nice!! and then CI/CD pipeline?
Are proto packages also moving off of bazel anytime soon?
